job.title: Head of Tax / Tax Director
job.description:
Description

We are looking to recruit a Head of Tax to help Crypto.com in its rapidly growing business.

This role offers the successful candidate a fantastic opportunity to manage the tax affairs of a business experiencing significant growth in a very dynamic industry.

Reporting to EVP, Finance, the Head of Tax will be responsible for the overall tax affairs for Crypto.com, including tax compliance, oversight of the relevant tax returns, tax planning and managing Crypto.com’s tax team.

This is a global role covering all Crypto.com’s entities and the successful candidate will work closely with external service providers and advisors, as well as the broader finance team across the globe and the related teams within the group.


Responsibilities

  • Direct and oversee the Crypto.com’s overall tax management - ensure compliance with applicable tax regulations, the accurate completion of all tax returns globally, tax strategy, planning, policies, and all operational aspects for tax matters
  • Manage all transfer pricing and all cross border arrangements from a tax perspective
  • Provide tax advisory and support to internal stakeholders for new business initiatives such as new products launch and M&A deals
  • Manage the Crypto.com tax team and the external providers/advisers used
  • Manage all tax related queries raised by auditors and tax authorities to deal with any
  • Monitor any changes in legislation and its implications on the Group and related entities
  • Recommend and implement process improvements related to tax filing, systems, etc
  • Ensure appropriate policies, procedures and controls are in place

Requirements

  • CPA/ relevant Tax qualification
  • Ideally 8+ years professional work experience in Tax; knowledge of crypto related tax subjects is a plus.
  • Solid experience in International Tax and Transfer Pricing is highly advantageous
  • Excellent project management, presentation and interpersonal skills
  • Detail oriented, analytical, with an ability to multitask in a high growth environment
  • Strong willingness to roll up their sleeves to get the job done
  • Passionate about start-ups and the growth of digital assets
  • Excellent command of spoken and written English
  • Good to have crypto knowledge
  • Estimate and monitor relevant cash flow impacts for tax related payments


Benefits

  • We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech.
  • Flat team. Work side by side with the co-founding team
  • Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you
  • You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team
  • You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team

job.title: Director, Growth Marketing Intelligence

job.description:
At IO Global, we believe that unlocking the potential of the community is essential to the success of the system, which is why developer experience is so important.

The Developer Experience Lead will build a keen sense of what tools, libraries, and capabilities DApp developers are seeking. They are both the voice of the customer and the development lead, shaping the end-to-end developer experience. The role will involve conceptualizing, defining, and leading the work on various tools and frameworks to make development easier.

Your mission

  • Develop solutions such as developer tools, libraries, and add-ons to improve Cardano’s developer experience, particularly the end-to-end experience of building DApps using Plutus.
  • Validate and experiment with early/pre-release feature developments to help ensure a robust and consistent developer experience.
  • Identify and ideate key features, tools, and libraries that can make the process of developing and testing smart contracts easier, faster, and secure.
  • Prepare well-informed reports of developers’ needs and detail the business and technical requirements to implement a solution.
  • Author and engage with the developer community via documentation, curated presentations, demonstrations, and learning guides to make it easy for developers to adopt and begin building on Cardano.
  • Build rapport and foster relationships with the Cardano ecosystem as a researcher/evangelist to build an understanding of their developer experience, common issues, and feature wants.

Your expertise

  • Haskell experience, either professional or otherwise.
  • Strong communication skills, paired with a track record of being able to build meaningful rapport with the developer communities
  • Strong reasoning capabilities with the drive to arrive at the root cause of developers’ wants
  • Enjoy being a “force multiplier” for other groups
  • Prior experience working as a developer and alongside development communities
  • High-level understanding of programming concepts, data structures, and algorithms.
  • This role is analogous to a UX lead role in that a UX lead role represents the voice of the customer, which is an end user, whereas the DevX lead is the voice of the developer using our infrastructure and tools to build DApps

Location

IOG is a fully distributed organization and therefore this is a remote position. Due to team distribution we are ideally searching for someone in a European or US East Coast timezone.

job.title: Project Manager (Europe Remote)
job.description:
Founded in 2012, Bitfinex is a digital asset trading platform offering state-of-the-art services for digital currency traders and global liquidity providers. We're on a mission to create the most innovative cryptocurrencies exchange. This is a unique opportunity, a rare window of time at the tipping point of the financial evolution. Much like the early days of the internet, blockchain technology faces complex new challenges and having the best team plays a pivotal role in success.

Our team is fully remote and globally distributed to capture the best talent from around the world. So far our company has grown fast and stayed lean to secure its place as a leader in the space.

If you get excited about being in an industry that is breaking new ground and have confidence you can conquer the most challenging feats we'll encounter, we want to talk to you. Join us, and help lay the foundation for a decentralized future

We are currently looking for:

Project Manager (Remote)

​Job description

As a Project Manager in the Product team, you will work with fellow project, program and product managers and with members of the engineering and design teams to execute our business and product strategies across the various Bitfinex products and services.

As a Project Manager at Bitfinex you will take ultimate responsibility for one key project. Of all product team members you are closest to the actual planning and implementation of individual projects, so expect to get your hands dirty. You will manage release cycles, running release sprints and retros; collaborate with the development, marketing, etc teams to break work down, taking large-scale projects and turning them into manageable tasks; track & report on progress to Program and Product Managers, and other stakeholders, to ensure business needs are being met; and generally do whatever it takes to ensure that things stay on track, figuring out alternatives if they don’t. In a nutshell, you own the project deliverables and support your team to deliver the highest standards of quality in a timely manner.

Project Managers have the opportunity to progress into: senior project management positions where they work on the most important projects in the company; program management roles that oversee multiple projects and a team of project managers; or product management roles focusing on our customers, our competitors, and business strategy. 


Responsibilities

  • Align project objectives with company goals, and make sure the project team is clear on objectives. Act as the voice of the product team and key stakeholders in their absence.

  • Ensure that the project targets are met within the project timeline and costs, and monitor and control all stages of the project life cycle. Suggest reasonable solutions and plans for the problems in the process of the project.

  • Coordinate the progress and quality of each stage of the project to ensure the smooth progress of the project and delivery on time.

  • Where necessary, lead communications with external partners supporting the project.

  • Lead process of issue identification and resolution.

  • Monitor and manage scope.

  • Manage all documentation, project tracking, and reporting within the product team and cross-functionally where necessary.

  • Streamline new token listings facilitating cross-department communication.

Requirements:

  • Minimum 2 years in a project management role working on software development or financial services.

  • Excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to develop these habits in the teams you join.

  • Self-starter attitude, strong problem solving skills and sense of responsibility.

  • Strong analytical and communication skills, and the ability to produce concise reports ongoing to management covering progress of projects, with an aim to improving decision-making on business strategy and product development.

  • Comprehensive understanding of project management methodologies and best practices, and experience implementing fast-moving, large teams.

job.title: People Operations Co-ordinator
job.description:
As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.

Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.


To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.


The impact you will have:

At Elliptic we know that our people are our best asset and you will be responsible for delivering our team an amazing employee experience!

You will join the People team, and alongside being the first point of contact for the US team you will be responsible for onboarding new team members and supporting and improving all our people processes.. Your role will be instrumental in ensuring that we can scale effectively and efficiently!

  • Delivering a world class remote onboarding experience for new joiners including:

  • Reporting on People data, such as annual leave and turnover rates and using these to drive people decisions and support strategic people initiative
  • Supporting the delivery of our People processes and frameworks including the engagement survey, performance review, compensation review etc
  • Researching and benchmarking compensation levels for new and existing roles
  • Championing and embodying our values and behaviours, preparing our quarterly value awards and celebrating our Chief Value Officers
  • Additional ad hoc people initiatives and duties

You will be a great fit here if you:

  • Love helping others and being a go-to person in the business
  • Are approachable and friendly, with the ability to put people at ease and engage with people across all areas and levels of the business
  • Embrace receiving feedback and using this to continually improve the experiences of employees and the processes that support this
  • Are extremely organised, with a genuine desire for producing high quality outputs and excellent attention to detail
  • Are technically savvy, comfortable picking up new systems and helping onboard others to new systems too
  • Are a real team player - this is a truly cross functional role, and is key to our success
  • Are passionate about the importance of the role the People team play in the delivery of company goals

Our ideal candidate has:

Experience in a People and/or Operations role that covers:

  • Managing onboarding for new joiners, with a focus on delivering an incredible experience at all times to both new joiners and their future managers
  • A generalist understanding of HR policies, laws and procedures in the U.S.
  • Experience managing sensitive data and keeping it accurate and up to date
  • Experience managing an HRIS
  • Experience with excel and using data to drive decision making

Bonus Points for:

  • Knowledge and understanding of HR policies, laws, and procedures in the U.K., Singapore and/or Japan
  • Knowledge of BambooHR
  • Experience delivering remote onboarding
  • Experience in a rapidly scaling software company
  • Competitive salary
  • Share options
  • Private health insurance
  • Strong focus on personal development, with $1,000 per annum personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription
  • Collaborative, flexible and friendly environment: We understand that flexibility is the key to maintaining a healthy work-life balance, especially at the moment. We’re working remotely right now and are carefully considering our strategy for remote working in the longer term
  • Social events, which include monthly team lunch on us, quarterly full day events and an annual company 3-day event - this year these are taking place virtually
  • Enhanced parental leave; we provide eligible employees, regardless of gender or whether they become a parent by birth or adoption, 16 weeks fully-paid leave and job-protected leave.


We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
